wikipedia_page.main: Isabella Harwood or Ross Neil (14 June 1837 – 29 May 1888) was a British novelist who also wrote dramas in verse.

response: Harwood was seriously ill in 1881, and in December 1883 he retired from the editorship and went to live in Hastings, where he died 10 December 1887. The novelist Isabella Harwood was his daughter and she died the following year also in Hastings.
